intro: Chasmanthera cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf chasmanthera, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Chasmanthera cordifolia is often found in shaded, moist environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities as well as its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
